alert.note: Alert for Butler (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Butler and north central Conecuh Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 408 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Evergreen. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Butler and north central Conecuh Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
